From LeanCamCombi

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [d73abce29c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13830/commits/d73abce29c7285f761242065d4d3f029cb6e5eb4)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_evalLatticeHom`
`+ coe_fst`
`+ coe_snd`
`+ evalLatticeHom`
`+ evalLatticeHom_apply`
`+ fst`
`+ fst_apply`
`+ snd`
`+ snd_apply`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9539632592/job/26290209013)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9539632592/job/26290208853)

Why repeat `LatticeHom` in NS and name? Other similar definitions use `Pi` as the namespace, e.g., [Pi.evalMonoidHom](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Pi/Lemmas.html#Pi.evalMonoidHom). Renamed by @eric-wieser in leanprover-community/mathlib#5851
I think the naming is all over the place here
I think we standardized on `FooHom.fst` and `Pi.evalFooHom`?
Uh, really? That's kind of a terrible in-between
Please just tell me what I should use and I will do it

> Please just tell me what I should use and I will do it

Please rename the Prod version to `FooHom.fst`, as you had them before. The Pi version is correctly named as you have it right now.

> Uh, really? That's kind of a terrible in-between

I think now that we're in Lean 4 we could reconsider the Pi naming in the face of dot notation (which works on the `.fst` definitions); but that's not something to mix into this PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Prod.fst` as a lattice hom
